Description: Body sherd of large Attic black-figured pottery lid; interior glazed black (partly fired red with black spots); exterior: from left, vertical chain of crude opposed palmettes bounded by dilute line; at right, black-figure decoration consisting of large fish tail possibly of Triton, to right with irregular scales and faded added white line along its length; at right, trace of black, e.g. heel of Herakles.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding palmette chain dividing scene, see British Museum 1886, 0401.1167. Perhaps from a Nikosthenic pyxis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0831) (Phase 1)
